text: Katharine, Duchess of Kent, (born Katharine Lucy Mary Worsley, 22 February 1933), is a member of the British Royal Family. Her husband, Prince Edward, Duke of Kent, is a first cousin of Queen Elizabeth II. Katharine was born in Hovingham, North Yorkshire, She was the youngest daughter of Sir William Worsley and Joyce Brunner She was married to Prince Edward, Duke of Kent in 1961, They have three children George, Lady Helen, and Lord Nicholas The Duchess of Kent became famous her conversion to Catholicism in 1994, the first member of the Royal Family to convert publicly since 1701. The Duchess of Kent is strongly associated with the world of music, and has performed as a member of several choirs. == Titles == 22 February 1933-8 June 1961: Miss Katharine Worsley 8 June 1961 Her Royal Highness The Duchess of Kent In Scotland Her Royal Highness The Countess of St Andrews In Northern Ireland: Baroness Downpatrick ==References== ==Other websites== * The Duchess of Kent at the Royal Family website * Future Talent Charity Website Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:English Roman Catholics Category:House of Windsor Category:British generals Category:British teachers Category:People from North Yorkshire
title: Katharine, Duchess of Kent
